newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: New Zealand shares end lower on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: New Zealand shares end lower on profit-taking.

text.p: * New Zealand shares end lower on profit-taking
280 -4 * NZSE-10 cap index -10.78 at 1,180.81 360 -2 * Volume NZ$62.07 million. Futures -6 at 1,188
Profit takers entered the New Zealand share market on Tuesday to take the market lower, but brokers said the uptrend would remain intact.
The NZSE-40 Capital Index ended 18.11 points down at 2,349.67 on strong volume.
Among the leaders, Telecom was the main driver, shifting down seven cents to NZ$7.52 after a string of record highs.
Telecom's movement was reflective of its performance as an ADR in the United States, where it traded at an equivalent of NZ$7.50 at New York's close.
Luke Koekoek at J.B. Were said it was simply a matter of the market being sold down after a very strong run.
He expected consolidation from here on, but that it would not take much to move the market up, purely because there were very few sellers.
"The uptrend definitely remains intact, but I think we might see some sideways movement before we see it go up again," he said.

Outside the leading issues, debt collector Baycorp Holdings gained six cents to NZ$3.08 after an upbeat annual meeting in Auckland where it told shareholders that profitability was running ahead of last year. -- James Gray (64 9 302 1253)
